docs.lead_paragraph: From the Boston Medical and Surgical Journal. As the heat of the season advances, bowel complaints make their appearance. These are the result, generally of indiscretion, showing itself either in over-eating, or in using crude barries and badly-cooked green vegetables.

headline.main: HAVANA.; Discussion of American Society and Institutions--The Apprentice System in Cuba, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the steamer Black Warrior I handed you the issue of our Journal of the 16th, having the first letter from a "Young Gentleman" at Spring Hill, near Mobile, Ala., which is really deserving of attention, whether it be from a young or an old man, and creditable to the writer as well as to the censors of our press for having the good sense to pass it for publication.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CHOLERA.--A large deputation of Germans came down this morning, from the Sixth Ward to the Health Committee, stating that eight deaths from cholera had occurred in 24 hours. The two persons mentioned yesterday as attacked, have died, making three in one family. Butchering was carried on in their residence, but has recently been prevented by the Health Committee. e six

docs.lead_paragraph: Church Intelligence. Rev. J. JAMES BAKER was installed pastor of the Baptist Church in Bethlehem, N. Y., on the 20th inst. The Presbytery of Champlain have licensed Rev. LOUIS BARIDON to preach among the French Catholics; also, Rev. JOHN R. HERRICK, as an evangelist. JOHN L. JONES was licensed by the Presbytery of Troy, in Salem, N. Y., 28th ult.
